part.narration: 2008. Graduation day. Down to Earth floats in a single cap. Somebody catches it.
Standing across the fence from that somebody is Yuki, holding her termination papers. She tears them apart and sheds a tear.
Yuki begins the walk of shame.
A Graduate from the class of 2008 calls out to her.
Yuki looks back. She mutters under her breath.
part.line: Nobody here speaks French. This is a trap. Approach with great caution.
part.narration: Yuki half-waves back..
They walk down the street together.Graduate leads to the train station, Player follows.
part.line: Old enough to drink, and you can't tell when it's happy hour? How do you survive?
I don't drink as much as I did before college.
Then again, I'm not really surviving, am I?
My senior year's college fund— that's all I had left to live on.
So we're not in the same boat, here.
So much for young and beautiful college grads outside the land of the rising sun.
Just think! Us graduates, on an epic journey to find Pomme-friendly work— but you're no graduate.
Opportunity lost! Stay in school, fool. This economy is unkind to the unemployed.
How are you going to make money after that fund runs out?
I'll figure that out when mom stops sending me her residuals.
Don't suck your parents dry, that's how people become NEET!
Not in Education, Employment, or Training.
People who wake up every morning and decide to jerk off to comic books instead of living their damn lives!
They lock the doors, close the windows, stock up on crappy food,
And take solace in throwing noodles in hot water, halfway making their bed, and sleeping for twelve hours.
part.narration: The two continue their walk without another word. The sights and sounds of Tokyo exist. The Graduate's cellphone rings.
The Graduate gives Yuki a thumbs-up and a grin. He covers the phone and to Yuki whispers:
part.line: It's the guys at tri-Ace, calling about my internship!
part.narration: The Graduate listens to the phone, all the while nodding and smiling. Then, he frowns.
part.line: You're — cutting the internship program? Too costly?
Well, I mean, you don't have to pay me—
Restricting employment to citizens of Japanese heritage? You can do that?
part.narration: A delay. The other end of the conversation's explaining something.
part.line: I see. Have a nice summer, sellouts.
part.narration: The graduate throws the phone at the train tracks. He smiles.

The Graduate storms past Yuki and onto the train. When Yuki gets on the train, she sees The Graduate at the door on the other side of the car. Shortly after, a group of Cap-and-Tassels board the train.This happens by default, and if the player attempts to move to the side of the train where The Graduate is, the people interrupt her by walking in quickly. The train starts.
The Cap-and-Tassels give the same reply, in different dialects.
part.line: Nothing much! So what are your plans for the future?
Work, in the grand old video game industry!
Hey, Yuki. Come over here; this exit'll make it easier to get off the train.
part.narration: Yuki begins to walk to the other side of the train car. The Cap-and-Tassels dream of the future.No dialogue progress until the player walks to the other side of the train.
A single Cap-and-Tassel clasps her hands together.
part.line: I got accepted for employment... the big time! I can't wait until I can work on...
part.narration: Yuki continues walking across the train car. Each of the Cap-and-Tassels holds a binder with a design document for a hit new video game.Written on the front of each binder is the game in question's series number, counting sequels, spinoffs, and remakes. These can be approximate, exactness isn't the point. Zoom in on Yuki. As Yuki passes a Cap-and-Tassel, that Cap-and-Tassel recites the game's marketing name. Vision text appears on the binder showing the series number of that game.
Every Cap-and-Tassel's phone rings. Meanwhile, Yuki looks outside.
Yuki is off the train. Just before it leaves, she hears the cries of every Cap-and-Tassel.

Yuki keeps on walking. Sudden cut out of the train station. Sudden cut out to the next block. Sudden cut down the street. Sudden cut, Sudden cut, Sudden cut all the way to Yuki's house. The sounds of the world get louder and louder as she walks the streets.

Yuki resides on the second floor of a humble Ota apartment with many people and few plants. The front yard of the complex is a patch of infertile dirt. Yuki walks upstairs and through the door.The door to Yuki's is brought to the player's attention. Player walk up the stairs to it.
